briefdescription.para: Option used with CFE_SB_RcvMsg to request immediate pipe status.
Option used with CFE_SB_RcvMsg to force a wait for next message.
Configuration parameter used by SBN App.
Subtype specifier used in CFE_SB_SubRprtMsg_t by SBN App.
Subtype specified used in CFE_SB_SubRprtMsg_t by SBN App.
Places a one at bit positions 0 - 31.
Sets bit x of i.
Clears bit x of i.
TRUE(non zero) if bit x of i is set.

detaileddescription.para: Macro that should be used to set memory addresses within software bus messages. For now this does a straight copy, but in a future revision this may translate the raw memory address into a "safe" integer value. This is particularly important if the message is to be sent off this CPU.
Macro that should be used to get memory addresses from software bus messages. This is the inverse operation of CFE_SB_SET_MEMADDR.

briefdescription.para: Size of CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t in bytes.
Size of CFE_SB_TlmHdr_t in bytes.
CFE_SB_TimeOut_t to primitive type definition.

detaileddescription.para: <Internally used by SB in the CFE_SB_RcvMsg API. Translated from the input parmater named TimeOut which specifies the maximum time in milliseconds that the caller wants to wait for a message.CFE_SB_PipeId_t to primitive type definition
Software Bus pipe identifier used in many SB APIs

briefdescription.para: CFE_SB_MsgId_t to primitive type definition.

detaileddescription.para: Software Bus message identifier used in many SB APIs

briefdescription.para: CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t defined as a pointer to an SB Message.
CFE_SB_MsgPayloadPtr_t defined as an opaque pointer to a message Payload portion.
CFE_SB_ZeroCopyId_t to primitive type definition.

detaileddescription.para: Software Zero Copy handle used in many SB APIs

briefdescription.para: Quality Of Service Type Definition.

detaileddescription.para: Currently an unused parameter in CFE_SB_SubscribeEx Intended to be used for interprocessor communication only

briefdescription.para: Defines a default priority and reliabilty for off-board routing.

detaileddescription.para: Parameter used in CFE_SB_GetLastSenderId API which allows the receiver of a message to validate the sender of the message.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new software bus pipe.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine creates and initializes an input pipe that the calling application can use to receive software bus messages. By default, no messages are routed to the new pipe. So, the application must use CFE_SB_Subscribe() to specify which messages it wants to receive on this pipe.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a variable of type CFE_SB_PipeId_t, which will be filled in with the pipe ID information by the CFE_SB_CreatePipe routine.
The maximum number of messages that will be allowed on this pipe at one time.
A string to be used to identify this pipe in error messages and routing information telemetry. The string must be no longer than OS_MAX_API_NAME. Longer strings will be truncated.
The identifier for the created pipe.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_CreatePipe when the SB cannot accomodate the request to create a pipe because the maximum number of pipes (#CFE_SB_MAX_PIPES) are in use. This configuration parameter is defined in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file.

The maximum number of queues(#OS_MAX_QUEUES) are in use. Or possibly a lower level problem with creating the underlying queue has occurred such as a lack of memory. If the latter is the problem, the status code displayed in the event must be tracked.

briefdescription.para: Delete a software bus pipe.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine deletes an input pipe and cleans up all data structures associated with the pipe. All subscriptions made for this pipe by calls to CFE_SB_Subscribe will be automatically removed from the SB routing tables. Any messages in the pipe will be discarded. Applications must call this routine for all of their SB pipes as part of their orderly shutdown process.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: The pipe ID (obtained previously from CFE_SB_CreatePipe) of the pipe to be deleted.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.

memberdef.argsstring: (CFE_SB_MsgId_t MsgId, CFE_SB_PipeId_t PipeId, CFE_SB_Qos_t Quality, uint16 MsgLim)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_SubscribeEx

briefdescription.para: Subscribe to a message on the software bus.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine adds the specified pipe to the destination list associated with the specified message ID.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: As subscriptions are received, the destinations are added to the head of a linked list. During the sending of a message, the list is traversed beginning at the head of the list. Therefore the message will first be sent to the last subscriber. If an application has timing constraints and needs to receive a message in the shortest possible time, the developer may consider holding off its subscription until other applications have subscribed to the message.

parameterdescription.para: The message ID of the message to be subscribed to.
The pipe ID of the pipe the subscribed message should be sent to.
The requested Quality of Service (QoS) required of the messages. Most callers will use CFE_SB_Default_Qos for this parameter.
The maximum number of messages with this Message ID to allow in this pipe at the same time.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully

Will be returned when calling one of the SB subscription API's if the SB routing table cannot accomodate another unique message ID because the platform configuration parameter #CFE_SB_MAX_MSG_IDS has been met.

Will be returned when calling one of the SB subscription API's if the SB routing table cannot accomodate another destination for a particular the given message ID. This occurs when the number of destinations in use meets the platform configuration parameter #CFE_SB_MAX_DEST_PER_PKT.
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_Subscribe, CFE_SB_SubscribeLocal, CFE_SB_Unsubscribe, CFE_SB_UnsubscribeLocal

briefdescription.para: Subscribe to a message on the software bus with default parameters.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine adds the specified pipe to the destination list for the specified message ID. This is the same as CFE_SB_SubscribeEx with the Quality field set to CFE_SB_Default_Qos and MsgLim set to #CFE_SB_DEFAULT_MSG_LIMIT (4).

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note: As subscriptions are received, the destinations are added to the head of a linked list. During the sending of a message, the list is traversed beginning at the head of the list. Therefore the message will first be sent to the last subscriber. If an application has timing constraints and needs to receive a message in the shortest possible time, the developer may consider holding off its subscription until other applications have subscribed to the message.

parameterdescription.para: The message ID of the message to be subscribed to.
The pipe ID of the pipe the subscribed message should be sent to.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully

Will be returned when calling one of the SB subscription API's if the SB routing table cannot accomodate another unique message ID because the platform configuration parameter #CFE_SB_MAX_MSG_IDS has been met.

Will be returned when calling one of the SB subscription API's if the SB routing table cannot accomodate another destination for a particular the given message ID. This occurs when the number of destinations in use meets the platform configuration parameter #CFE_SB_MAX_DEST_PER_PKT.
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SubscribeEx, CFE_SB_SubscribeLocal, CFE_SB_Unsubscribe, CFE_SB_UnsubscribeLocal

briefdescription.para: Subscribe to a message while keeping the request local to a cpu.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine adds the specified pipe to the destination list for the specified message ID. This is similar to CFE_SB_SubscribeEx with the Quality field set to CFE_SB_Default_Qos and MsgLim set to #CFE_SB_DEFAULT_MSG_LIMIT, but will not report the subscription. Subscription Reporting is enabled for interprocessor communication by way of the Software Bus Network (SBN) Application.

listitem.para: This API is typically only used by Software Bus Network (SBN) Application

parameterdescription.para: The message ID of the message to be subscribed to.
The pipe ID of the pipe the subscribed message should be sent to.
The maximum number of messages with this Message ID to allow in this pipe at the same time.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully

Will be returned when calling one of the SB subscription API's if the SB routing table cannot accomodate another unique message ID because the platform configuration parameter #CFE_SB_MAX_MSG_IDS has been met.

Will be returned when calling one of the SB subscription API's if the SB routing table cannot accomodate another destination for a particular the given message ID. This occurs when the number of destinations in use meets the platform configuration parameter #CFE_SB_MAX_DEST_PER_PKT.
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_Subscribe, CFE_SB_SubscribeEx, CFE_SB_Unsubscribe, CFE_SB_UnsubscribeLocal

briefdescription.para: Remove a subscription to a message on the software bus.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine removes the specified pipe from the destination list for the specified message ID.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: The message ID of the message to be unsubscribed.
The pipe ID of the pipe the subscribed message should no longer be sent to.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
This error code is returned by the CFE_SB_Unsubscribe API if there has not been an entry in the routing tables for the MsgId/PipeId given as parameters.
This error code will be returned by the CFE_SB_Subscribe API if the code detects an internal index is out of range. The most likely cause would be a Single Event Upset.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_Subscribe, CFE_SB_SubscribeEx, CFE_SB_SubscribeLocal, CFE_SB_UnsubscribeLocal

briefdescription.para: Remove a subscription to a message on the software bus on the current CPU.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine removes the specified pipe from the destination list for the specified message ID on the current CPU.

listitem.para: This API is typically only used by Software Bus Network (SBN) Application

parameterdescription.para: The message ID of the message to be unsubscribed.
The pipe ID of the pipe the subscribed message should no longer be sent to.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
This error code is returned by the CFE_SB_Unsubscribe API if there has not been an entry in the routing tables for the MsgId/PipeId given as parameters.
This error code will be returned by the CFE_SB_Subscribe API if the code detects an internal index is out of range. The most likely cause would be a Single Event Upset.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_Subscribe, CFE_SB_SubscribeEx, CFE_SB_SubscribeLocal, CFE_SB_Unsubscribe

briefdescription.para: Send a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sends the specified message to all subscribers. The software bus will read the message ID from the message header to determine which pipes should receive the message.

listitem.para: This routine will not normally wait for the receiver tasks to process the message before returning control to the caller's task.
However, if a higher priority task is pending and subscribed to this message, that task may get to run before CFE_SB_SendMsg returns control to the caller.
This function tracks and increments the source sequence counter of a telemetry message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the message to be sent. This must point to the first byte of the software bus message header (CFE_SB_Msg_t).

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.
The size field in the message header indicates the message exceeds the max Software Bus message size. The max size is defined by configuration parameter CFE_SB_MAX_SB_MSG_SIZE in cfe_mission_cfg.h

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_RcvMsg, CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend, CFE_SB_PassMsg

briefdescription.para: Passes a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sends the specified message to all subscribers. The software bus will read the message ID from the message header to determine which pipes should receive the message. This routine is intended to pass messages not generated by the sending application.

listitem.para: This routine will not normally wait for the receiver tasks to process the message before returning control to the caller's task.
However, if a higher priority task is pending and subscribed to this message, that task may get to run before CFE_SB_PassMsg returns control to the caller.
Unlike CFE_SB_SendMsg this routine will preserve the source sequence counter in a telemetry message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the message to be sent. This must point to the first byte of the software bus message header (CFE_SB_Msg_t).

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.
The size field in the message header indicates the message exceeds the max Software Bus message size. The max size is defined by configuration parameter CFE_SB_MAX_SB_MSG_SIZE in cfe_mission_cfg.h

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_RcvMsg, CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend, CFE_SB_SendMsg

briefdescription.para: Receive a message from a software bus pipe.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine retrieves the next message from the specified pipe. If the pipe is empty, this routine will block until either a new message comes in or the timeout value is reached.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note - If an error occurs in this API, the *BufPtr value may be NULL or random. Therefore, it is recommended that the return code be tested for CFE_SUCCESS before processing the message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a local variable of type CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t. Typically a caller declares a ptr of type CFE_SB_Msg_t (i.e. CFE_SB_Msg_t *Ptr) then gives the address of that pointer (&Ptr) as this parmeter. After a successful receipt of a message, *BufPtr will point to the first byte of the software bus message header. This should be used as a read-only pointer (in systems with an MMU, writes to this pointer may cause a memory protection fault). The *BufPtr is valid only until the next call to CFE_SB_RcvMsg for the same pipe.
The pipe ID of the pipe containing the message to be obtained.

The number of milliseconds to wait for a new message if the pipe is empty at the time of the call. This can also be set to CFE_SB_POLL for a non-blocking receive or CFE_SB_PEND_FOREVER to wait forever for a message to arrive.
A pointer to the message obtained from the pipe. Valid only until the next call to CFE_SB_RcvMsg for the same pipe.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.
In CFE_SB_RcvMsg, this return value indicates that a packet has not been received in the time given in the "timeout" parameter.

This return value indicates an error at the Queue read level. This error typically cannot be corrected by the caller. Some possible causes are: queue was not properly initialized or created, the number of bytes read from the queue was not the number of bytes requested in the read. The queue id is invalid. Similar errors regarding the pipe will be caught by higher level code in the Software Bus.
When "Polling" a pipe for a message in CFE_SB_RcvMsg, this return value indicates that there was not a message on the pipe.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SendMsg, CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the application Info of the sender for the last message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine can be used after a successful CFE_SB_RcvMsg call to find out which application sent the message that was received.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Note - If an error occurs in this API, the *Ptr value may be NULL or random. Therefore, it is recommended that the return code be tested for CFE_SUCCESS before reading the sender information.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a local variable of type CFE_SB_SenderId_t. Typically a caller declares a ptr of type CFE_SB_SenderId_t (i.e. CFE_SB_SenderId_t *Ptr) then gives the address of that pointer (&Ptr) for this parameter. After a successful call to this API, *Ptr will point to the first byte of the CFE_SB_SenderId_t structure containing the sender information for the last message received on the given pipe. This should be used as a read-only pointer (in systems with an MMU, writes to this pointer may cause a memory protection fault). The *Ptr is valid only until the next call to CFE_SB_RcvMsg for the same pipe.
The pipe ID of the pipe the message was taken from.

entry.para: The sender's application ID

briefdescription.para: Get a buffer pointer to use for "zero copy" SB sends.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine can be used to get a pointer to one of the software bus' internal memory buffers that are used for sending messages. The caller can use this memory buffer to build an SB message, then send it using the CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend function. This interface is more complicated than the normal CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend interface, but it avoids an extra copy of the message from the user's memory buffer to the software bus internal buffer. The "zero copy" interface can be used to improve performance in high-rate, high-volume software bus traffic.

listitem.para: The pointer returned by CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr is only good for one call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend.
Applications should be written as if CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr is equivalent to a malloc() and CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend is equivalent to a free().
Applications must not de-reference the message pointer (for reading or writing) after the call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the SB message buffer the caller wants (including the SB message header).
A handle that must be supplied when sending or releasing in zero copy mode.

entry.para: A pointer to a memory buffer that can be used to build one SB message for use with CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_ZeroCopyReleasePtr, CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend

briefdescription.para: Release an unused "zero copy" buffer pointer.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine can be used to release a pointer to one of the software bus' internal memory buffers.

listitem.para: This function is not needed for normal "zero copy" transfers. It is needed only for cleanup when an application gets a pointer using CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr, but (due to some error condition) never uses that pointer for a CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the SB internal buffer. This must be a pointer returned by a call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr, but never used in a call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend.
This must be the handle supplied with the pointer when CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr was called.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
This error code will be returned when a request to release or send a zero copy buffer is invalid, such as if the handle or buffer is not correct or the buffer was previously released.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr, CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend

briefdescription.para: Send an SB message in "zero copy" mode.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sends a message that has been created directly in an internal SB message buffer by an application (after a call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr). This interface is more complicated than the normal CFE_SB_SendMsg interface, but it avoids an extra copy of the message from the user's memory buffer to the software bus internal buffer. The "zero copy" interface can be used to improve performance in high-rate, high-volume software bus traffic.

listitem.para: The pointer returned by CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr is only good for one call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend.
Callers must not use the same SB message buffer for multiple sends.
Applications should be written as if CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr is equivalent to a malloc() and CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend is equivalent to a free().
Applications must not de-reference the message pointer (for reading or writing) after the call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend.
This function tracks and increments the source sequence counter of a telemetry message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the SB message to be sent.
The handle supplied with the CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr call.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.
The size field in the message header indicates the message exceeds the max Software Bus message size. The max size is defined by configuration parameter CFE_SB_MAX_SB_MSG_SIZE in cfe_mission_cfg.h

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.
This error code will be returned when a request to release or send a zero copy buffer is invalid, such as if the handle or buffer is not correct or the buffer was previously released.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SendMsg, CFE_SB_RcvMsg, CFE_SB_ZeroCopyReleasePtr, CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr

briefdescription.para: Pass an SB message in "zero copy" mode.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sends a message that has been created directly in an internal SB message buffer by an application (after a call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr). This interface is more complicated than the normal CFE_SB_SendMsg interface, but it avoids an extra copy of the message from the user's memory buffer to the software bus internal buffer. The "zero copy" interface can be used to improve performance in high-rate, high-volume software bus traffic. This version is intended to pass messages not generated by the caller (to preserve the source sequence count).

listitem.para: The pointer returned by CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr is only good for one call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend or CFE_SB_ZeroCopyPass.
Callers must not use the same SB message buffer for multiple sends.
Applications should be written as if CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr is equivalent to a malloc() and CFE_SB_ZeroCopyPass is equivalent to a free().
Applications must not de-reference the message pointer (for reading or writing) after the call to CFE_SB_ZeroCopyPass.
Unlike CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend this routine will preserve the source sequence counter in a telemetry message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the SB message to be sent.
The handle supplied with the CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr call.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
A parameter given by a caller to a Software Bus API did not pass validation checks.
The size field in the message header indicates the message exceeds the max Software Bus message size. The max size is defined by configuration parameter CFE_SB_MAX_SB_MSG_SIZE in cfe_mission_cfg.h

This error code will be returned from CFE_SB_SendMsg when the memory in the SB message buffer pool has been depleted. The amount of memory in the pool is dictated by the configuration parameter #CFE_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES specified in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file. Also the memory statistics, including current utilization figures and high water marks for the SB Buffer memory pool can be monitored by sending a Software Bus command to send the SB statistics packet.
This error code will be returned when a request to release or send a zero copy buffer is invalid, such as if the handle or buffer is not correct or the buffer was previously released.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_PassMsg, CFE_SB_ZeroCopySend, CFE_SB_ZeroCopyReleasePtr, CFE_SB_ZeroCopyGetPtr

memberdef.argsstring: (void *MsgPtr, CFE_SB_MsgId_t MsgId, uint16 Length, boolean Clear)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Initialize a buffer for a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine fills in the header information needed to create a valid software bus message.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that will contain the message. This will point to the first byte of the message header. The void* data type allows the calling routine to use any data type when declaring its message buffer.
The message ID to put in the message header.
The total number of bytes of message data, including the SB message header .

A flag indicating whether to clear the rest of the message:
TRUE - fill sequence count and packet data with zeroes.
FALSE - leave sequence count and packet data unchanged.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode

briefdescription.para: Get the size of a software bus message header.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the number of bytes in a software bus message header. This can be used for sizing buffers that need to store SB messages. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function and avoid hard coding their buffer sizes.

listitem.para: For statically defined messages, a function call will not work. The macros CFE_SB_CMD_HDR_SIZE and CFE_SB_TLM_HDR_SIZE are available for use in static message buffer sizing or structure definitions.

parameterdescription.para: The message ID to calculate header size for. The size of the message header may depend on the MsgId in some implementations. For example, if SB messages are implemented as CCSDS packets, the size of the header is different for command vs. telemetry packets.

entry.para: The number of bytes in the software bus message header for messages with the given MsgId. endstmt

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer to the user data portion of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns a pointer to the user data portion of a software bus message. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function and avoid hard coding offsets into their SB message buffers.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message.

entry.para: A pointer to the first byte of user data within the software bus message.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Get the message ID of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the message ID from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message.

entry.para: The software bus Message ID from the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the message ID of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the Message ID in a software bus message header.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The message ID to put into the message header.

entry.para: The software bus Message ID from the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the length of user data in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the size of the user data in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The size (in bytes) of the user data in the software bus message.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the length of user data in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the field in the SB message header that determines the size of the user data in a software bus message. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function rather than trying to poke a length value directly into their SB message buffers.

listitem.para: You must set a valid message ID in the SB message header before calling this function.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The length to set (size of the user data, in bytes).

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the total length of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the total size of the software bus message.

listitem.para: For the CCSDS implementation of this API, the size is derived from the message header.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The total size (in bytes) of the software bus message, including headers.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the total length of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the field in the SB message header that determines the total length of the message. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function rather than trying to poke a length value directly into their SB message buffers.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The length to set (total size of the message, in bytes, including headers).

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the time field from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets the time from a software bus message.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a time field, then this routine will return a zero time.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The system time included in the software bus message header (if present), otherwise, returns a time value of zero.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the time field in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the time of a software bus message. Most applications will want to use CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg instead of this function. But, when needed, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime can be used to send a group of SB messages with identical time stamps.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a time field, then this routine will do nothing to the message contents and will return CFE_SB_WRONG_MSG_TYPE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The time to include in the message. This will usually be a time returned by the function CFE_TIME_GetTime().

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
This error code will be returned when a request such as ...SetMsgTime is made on a packet that does not include a field for msg time.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Sets the time field in a software bus message with the current spacecraft time.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the time of a software bus message with the current spacecraft time. This will be the same time that is returned by the function CFE_TIME_GetTime.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a time field, then this routine will do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the command code field from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets the command code from a software bus message (if SB messages are implemented as CCSDS packets, this will be the function code).

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a command code field, then this routine will return a zero.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The command code included in the software bus message header (if present). Otherwise, returns a command code value of zero.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the command code field in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the command code of a software bus message (if SB messages are implemented as CCSDS packets, this will be the function code).

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a command code field, then this routine will do nothing to the message contents and will return CFE_SB_WRONG_MSG_TYPE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The command code to include in the message.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
This error code will be returned when a request such as ...SetMsgTime is made on a packet that does not include a field for msg time.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the checksum field from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets the checksum (or other message integrity check value) from a software bus message. The contents and location of this field will depend on the underlying implementation of software bus messages. It may be a checksum, a CRC, or some other algorithm. Users should not call this function as part of a message integrity check (call CFE_SB_ValidateChecksum instead).

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a checksum field, then this routine will return a zero.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The checksum included in the software bus message header (if present), otherwise, returns a checksum value of zero.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize, CFE_SB_ValidateChecksum, CFE_SB_GenerateChecksum

briefdescription.para: Calculates and sets the checksum of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine calculates the checksum of a software bus message according to an implementation-defined algorithm. Then, it sets the checksum field in the message with the calculated value. The contents and location of this field will depend on the underlying implementation of software bus messages. It may be a checksum, a CRC, or some other algorithm.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a checksum field, then this routine will do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_ValidateChecksum, CFE_SB_GetChecksum

briefdescription.para: Validates the checksum of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine calculates the expected checksum of a software bus message according to an implementation-defined algorithm. Then, it checks the calculated value against the value in the message's checksum. If the checksums do not match, this routine will generate an event message reporting the error.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a checksum field, then this routine will always return TRUE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: TRUE
The checksum field in the packet is valid.
FALSE
The checksum field in the packet is not valid or the message type is wrong.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GenerateChecksum, CFE_SB_GetChecksum

memberdef.argsstring: (char *DestStringPtr, const char *SourceStringPtr, const char *DefaultString, uint32 DestMaxSize, uint32 SourceMaxSize)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_MessageStringGet

memberdef.argsstring: (char *DestStringPtr, const char *SourceStringPtr, uint32 DestMaxSize, uint32 SourceMaxSize)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_MessageStringSet
